title: Setting the parameters for launch of Vikings AMM
body:
As those following Vikings.Finance would be aware, to further grow out and utilise the Protocol Owned Liquidity that the Vikings.Finance treasury owns we plan to launch a Automated Market Maker Decentralised Exchange (AMM/DEX).

BACKGROUND

We would use a Uniswap V2 model for our AMM and have made the decision to launch our first liquidity pair as AVAX-MIM as this is a high volume pair on the Avalanche Network. As we build liquidity we hope to see our DEX increasingly used by Bots and Arbitrageurs against other DEXs in the space, additionally as TVL and awareness grows we hope to increase more mainstream use (through DEX aggregators and regular users).

As usage grows we hope to add more and more liquidity pairs to our DEX to snowball adoption. We would welcome community feedback as to what these would be moving forward.

A key parameter in the development of this AMM is the trading fee. Given Vikings.Finance owns all the LPs in the AMM as well as the AMM itself, we are able to capture 100% of all fees in our Vikings.Finance treasury.

PROPOSAL

We have outlined a variety of options for trading fee % and would welcome feedback as to what the DAO finds most appropriate. Keeping in mind, in theory at least, lower fees may mean more volume, but less revenue and visa versa.

For reference Sushiswap, Uniswap V2 and TraderJoe all have a 0.30% trading fee.
author: 0x2981bb8f2883a462C5c413DE604C3B3e36884800
